surface.line: {left margin} Jose Rafael
En este curato de Taos a los sinco dias del mes de agosto
del año de 1839 yo el cura don Antonio Jose Martines bautise
solemnemente puse santos oleos y sagrado crisma a un parvulo
de seis dias de nacido y le puse por nombre Jose Rafael hijo
natural de Guadalupe Vigil yndia famula del difunto Jose
Vigil vecino de la plaza de Santisima Trinidad de Arroyo Seco fue-
ron padrinos Francisco Tomas Bentos y Maria Soledad Vigil
vecinos del mismo lugar a quienes adverti su obligacion y paren-
tesco espiritual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Juan Manuel
En este curato de Taos a los siete dias del mes de septiembre de mil
ochocientos trienta y nueve yo el cura don Antonio Jose Martines bautize solemnemente
puse santos oleos y crisma a un indito resca[ta]do de la tribu yuta como de edad
siete a ocho años el cual aunque hace un año que ha sido rescatado aun
no esta suficientement instruido pero hallandose enfermo y en lo poco que a
aprendido haberse explicado con eficacion que desea enco(^m)[r]porarse en la religion
de Jesucristo lo verefique es famulo de Don Carlos Beubien vecino de San
Fernandes y fueron sus padrinos Eugenio Letendosen? y Maria Rufina Vigil
tambien de San Fernandes a quienes adverti su obligasion y parentesco espiritual
y para que conste lo firme. [^ el nombre del bautisada fue Juan Manuel]
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Soledad
En este curato de Taos a los viente y tres dias del mes de
marzo del año de mil ochocientos cuarenta yo el cura don
Antonio Jose Martines bautise solemnemente puse santos oleos
y sagrado crisma en urgente necidad de enfermedad a una adulta co-
mo a edad de veinte años lo que hise segun el rito de nuestra Santa
Madre Iglesia acerca del bautismo de adulto previos catequismos que
le habia comensado a hacer y que se hallaba medianamente instruida en
los principios medios y fin de nuestra santa religion todo suficiente para
que ella en el caso que se hallaba fuere atendida a la solisitud de cris-
tianane le puse por nombre Maria Soledad es desendiente de la
tribu nabajo famula de la señora Maria Teodora Romero quien
la rescato y ella misma fue madrina y su hijo George Antonio
es de la Plaza de San Fernando a quienes adverti la obligacion y espi-
ritual y parentesco y firme y por constancia.
Antonio Jose Martines {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Gabriela
En este curato de Taos a los trese dias del mes de agosto de mil ocho-
cientos cuarenta yo el cura don Antonio Jose Martinez bautize solemnemente a
una parvula de dos años [^a quien puse por nombre Maria Gabriela] rescatada en la nacion palluche y famula de
Jose Gabriel Gallegos fueron padrinos Jose Nasario Gallegos y Maria
Antonia Gallegos vecinos del Arroyo Seco a quienes adberti su obli-
gacion y parentesco espiritual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin}
Jose Miguel
En este curato de Taos a los tres dias del mes
de noviembre de mil ochocientos cuarenta y uno
yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martines bautise solemnente
y puse santos oleos y sagrado crisma a una parvulo
de cinco años de edad y lo puse por nombre Jose
Miguel indio rescatado
de la tribu yuta es famulo
de Juan Antonio Abeyta, y fue padrino Pablo
Garduño vecinos son de la Plaza de Nuestra
Señora de Guadalupe y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Jose de la Cruz
En este curato de Taos a los dos dias del mes de febrero el año de
mil ochocientos cuarenta y dos yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martinez
habiendo tenido solicitud desde el anterior año para cris-
tianarse de un adulto edad de 30 años decendiente de la trivu Gi-
carilla y desde entonces lo previne que devia instruirse en
conocimiento de los misterios principales de nuestra santa
fe y religion y en los mandamientos o preseptos que toman
los cristianos a su obligacion y el motivo por que se determi-
naba a cristianarse advirtiendole desde entonces que el fin
principal era servir a Dios en esta vida y despues verle y
gozarle en la bienaventuranza que tiene a sus escojidos en
la otra mas a esta fecha habidos los correspondientes cate-
quimos lo halle instruido en aquello que toca al princi-
pio medio y fin de nuestra santa religion y que se determi-
naba a cristianarse para que Dios le perdonara todos los pe-
cados incurridos hasta la presente estar habil para reci-
bir los otros sacramentos y sirviendole con fidelidad de
aqui en lo de adelante conseguir la gloria eterna al ultimo
de sus dias que nunca ira cresido en cosas del gentilismo
de sus errores e idolatrias sino solo en el Dios verdadero
que ahora por medio del bautismo trata de reconocer
y adorar con mas eficacia en tal virtud y con facultad
que para esto tengo comedida especialmente mi superior eccle-
ciastico lo ecsorcise puse santos oleos bautice y ungi con
el sagrado crisma todo solemnemente segun rito de Nuestra
Madre la Santa Yglecia para los bautismos de adultos
fureron su padrinos Francisco Esteban Vigil y Maria Rosalia
Gallegos vecinos de la plasa de Nuestra Señora de los Dolores a quienes
adverti su obligacion y parentesco espiritual y para que
conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Catarina
En este curato de Taos a los viente y cuatro dias del mes de mayo de
mil ochocientos cuarenta y dos yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martinez
bautise solemnemente puse santos oleos y sagrado a una parbula de seis
años de edad descendiente de la tribu lluta de donde la rescato
el ciudadano Jose Mondragon vecino de la plaza de San Francisco del Rancho
fueron padrino Felipe Nerio Maes y Maria del Refugio Pacheco vecinos
del mismo lugar a quienes adverti su obligacion y paren-
tesco espiritual y para que conste lo firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria de la Luz
En este curato de Taos a los veinte y seis dias del mes de junio de mil ochocientos
cuarenta y dos yo el presbitero don Jose de la Cruz Vigil como coadjutor bautize so-
lemnemente puso santos oleos y sagrado crisma a una parbula de cuatro años
edad y le puse por nombre Maria de la Luz es descendiente de la tribu
lluta famula de don Juan Bolem quien la rescato vecino de San Francisco
del Rancho fueron padrinos Juan Bautista Bolem y Maria Luisa Ar-
chuleta vecinos del mismo lugar a quienes adverti su obligaciones y paren-
tesco espirituales y para que conste lo firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Serafina
En esta curato de Taos a los veinte y seis dias del mes de junio
del año de mil ochosientos cuarenta y dos yo el presbitero don Antonio Jose de la Cruz
Vigil como coadjutor bautize solemnemente puse santos oleos y
sagrado crisma a una parabula de cinco años de edad y le puse
por nombre Maria Serafina es descendiente de la tribu lluta famu-
la de don Juan Bolem? quien la rescato vecino de San Fransisco del
Rancho fueron padrinos Buenaventura Lovato y Maria Dolores Cordova vecinos del
mismo lugar a quienes adverti sus obligaciones y parentesco es-
piritual y para que conste lo firme
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
Jose Vigil {rubic}
{left margin} Jose Santiago
En este cuarato de Taos a los viente y seis del mes de junio de
mil ochocientos curanta y dos yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martines previos
catequismos segun lo pre[ve]nida para el bautismo de adultos y obtenida la com-
petente instruccion y conforme las especiales ritualidades exorcise bautise
solemnemente poniendo santos oleos y sagrado crisma a un adulto como de
edad de trece años descendiente del tribu yuta famulo de don Juan Ro-
les quien lo rescato corren algunos años en cuya casa el vario de San Francis-
co del Rancho ha sido educado y lo halle suficientemente instruido en el
principio medio y fin de la religion cristiana muy afecto deseoso y pre-
tendiente de ser recibido en ella en la fe y esperansa de conseguir la vida eterna
le puse por nombre Jose Santiago fueron padrinos Manuel Antonio Sando-
bal y Margarita Martines todos vecinos de San Francisco del Ran-
cho aquienes adverti su obligacion y parentesco espiritual y para que
conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martines {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Florentina
En este curato de Taos a los dies y seis dias del mes de octobre de mil ocho-
cientos cuarenta y dos yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martines bautise solem-
nemente puse santos oleos y sagrado crisma a una parbula de un dia
de nacida y le puse por nombre Maria Florentina hija natural de una india
famula de la señora Ygnacia Xaramillo vecina desta plaza de Nuestra Se-
ñora de Guadalupe fueron padrinos Francisco Xaramillo y Maria Rumal-
da de Luna vecinos del mismo lugar a quienes adverti su obligacion
y parentesco espiritual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Catarina
En este curato de Taos a los once dias del mes de enero de mil
ochocientos cuarenta y dos yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martines por extre-
ma nesecidad y estar certificado en virtud de catequismos y pulsada
la intencion y deseos de ser cristiana una adulta de dies y seis años
de edad la exorsice bautice solemnemente puse santos oleos y
sagrado crisma a la misma y le puse por nombre Catarina es
yndia sirviente de don Juan Manuel Lucero vecino de la plas[^a]
de San Francisco de Pauda el mismo fue padrino y su esposa Juana
Maria Martinez les adverti la obligacion que como amos de
dicha famula y tambien como padrinos tenian sobre darle
y cuidar de su educacion sobre ensenarle los debe(a)[re]s de cristian[os]
y el parentesco espiritual que contrajeron y para que conste
firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{lefft margin} Jose Manuel
En este curato de Taos a los doce dias del mes de noviembre
de mil ochocientos cuarenta y tres yo el parroco don Antonio Jose
Martines bautise solemnemente puse santos oleos y sagrado crisma
segun el rito de nuestra Santa Madre Yglesia para adultos
a un indito de diez años de edad el cual fue rescatado de
la tribu del norte y le puse por nombre Jose Manuel
es famulo de don Gabriel Abeyta el mismo fue padrino y su
esposa Maria de la Encarnacion de la Encarnacion Romero vecinos de
la Plaza de San Francsicso del Rancho a quienes adverti su obligacion
y parentesco espiritual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Juan Francisco
En este curato de Taos a los diez dias del mes de diciembre de mil
ochocientos cuarenta y tres yo el parraco don Antonio Jose Martinez bautice
solemnemente puse santos oleos y sagrado crisma a un parvulo de
un mes de nacido y le puse por nombre Juan Francisco desendien-
te de la tribu yuta de que fue rescatado es famulo de Antonio
dias Armenta y de Maria Ysabel Sanches fueron padrinos Juan
Antonio Madrid y Maria Manuela Romero vecinos todos de la po-
blacion del Rio Colorado a quienes adverti su obligacion y paren-
tesco espiritual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Antonia
En este curato de Taos a los catorce dias del mes de
abril de mil ochocientos cuarenta y cuatro yo el parro-
co don Antonio Jose Martines bautise solemnemente
puse santos oleos y sagrado crismo a una (^parvula) [^adulta] de
trece años de edad de la tribu nabajo y le puse
por nombre Maria Antonia famula de Miguel
Mascareñas vecinos de la plaza de Santa Gertrudis
este bautismo fue segun rito de Nuestra
Santa Madre Yglesia para adultos previos cate-
quismos y aprobacion fueron padrinos Nasario
Aguilar y Maria de las Cruz Mascareñas vecinos
del mismo lugar a quienes adverti su obligacion
y parentesco espiritual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Josefa
En este curato de Taos a los veinte y cicno dias del mes de agosto de mil
ochocientos cuarenta y cuatro yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martinez bau-
tise solemnemente puse santos oleos y sagrado crisma a una parvula de
siete años de edad es de la tribu yuta de donde fue rescatada es fa-
mula de don Juan Manuel Lucero y de doña Juana Maria Marti-
nez ellos mismos fueron padrinos son vecinos de la Plaza de San
Francisco de Paula les adverti su obligacion y parentesco espiritual y
para que conste firme su nombre Maria Josefa.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Dolores
En este curato de Taos a los veinte y cinco dias del mes de agosto de mil
ochocientos cuarenta y cuatro yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martinez bau-
tise solemnemente segun el rito de Nuestra Madre la Santa Yglesia
para el bautismos de adultos exorsize puse santos oleos y sagrado cris-
ma a una adulta de doce años de edad y le puse por nombre
Maria Dolores es india de la tribu nabajo de donde fue rescatada para
todo fueron previos los pasos de catequismos y fue hallada bien ins-
truida en los principios medios y fin de nuestra santa religion y deseo-
sa de ser admitida a su profesion por medio de santo sacramento del
bautismo abjuro los errores y principios que habia adquirido en
su secta gentilica quedando en toda y la mas fuerte resolucion de
vivir en la observacion desta religion cristiana que se le confiere
en el bautismo es famula de Jose del Espiritu Santo Cordova y
fueron sus padrinos Jose Dolores Duran y Juana Maria de Grazia San-
ches toosr vecinos de San Francisco del Rancho a quienes adverti su obliga-
cion y parentesco espiritual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Jose Matias
En este curato de Taos a los tres dias del
mes de octubre de mil ochocientos cuarenta
y cuatro yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Mar-
tinez previos los catequismos correspon-
dientes hasta haber hallado bien ins-
struido en los principios medios y fin de
nuestra santa religion exorsise bautise so-
lemnemente puse santos oleos y sagrado cris-
ma a un adulto de ocho años de edad
segun el rito de nuestra Santa Madre Yglesia
para el bautismo de adultos y le puse
por nombre Jose Matias famulo de Fer-
nando Trugillo y de Juana Maria Trugillo ve-
cinos de la Plaza de Nuestra Señora de Gua-
dalupe ellos mismos fueron padrinos
dicho adulto es descendiente de la tri-
bu yuta de donde fue rescatado adver-
ti a dichos padrinos y amos su obligacion
y parentesco espiritual y para que conste
firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Antonia
En este curato de Taos a los tres dias del
mes de octubre de mil ochocientos cuaren-
ta y cuatro yo el parroco don Antonio Jose
Martinez bautise solemnemente puse
santos oleos y sagrado crisma a una par-
vula de cuatro años de edad y le puse
por nombre Maria Antonia es yndia des-
cendiente de la tribu yuta de la cual
fue rescatada es famula de doña Maria
Rafaela Varela vecina de la plasa de Nu-
estra Señora de Guadalupe fueron padri-
nos Pablo Valdez y Maria Magdalena Gal-
legos vecinos del mismo lugar a quienes
adverti su obligacion y parentesco espiri-
tual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Juan Lorenso
En este curato de Taos a los cuatro dias del
mes de octubre de mil ochocientos cuarenta y
cuatro yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martinez
bautise solemnemente puse santo oleos y sagra-
do crisma a un parvulo de edad seis años des-
cendiente de la tribu yuta de la que fue resca-
tado es famulo de Juan Ygnacio Martinez
vecinos de la plaza de San Francisco del
Rancho y le puse por nombre Juan Lo-
renso fueron padrinos Benito Martinez y
Maria Rosalia Mascareñas vecinos del mismo
lugar a quienes adverti su obligacion y paren-
tesco espiritual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Soledad
En este curato de Taos a los cuatro dias
del mes de octubre de mil ochocientos cua-
renta y cuatro yo el parraco don Antonio
Jose Martinez bautise solemnemente puse
santos oleos y sagrado crisma a una parvula
de cinco años de edad y puse por nombre
Maria Soledad es descendiente de la tribu yuta
famula de Juan Ygnacio Martinez vecino
de San Francisco del Rancho fueron padrinos
Jose Rafael Martinez y Maria Rosa Martinez
vecinos del mismo lugar a quienes adverti
su obligacion y parentesco espiritual y para
que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Juan Francisco
En este curato de Taos a los cinco dias del
mes de octubre de mil ochocientos cua-
renta y cuatro yo el parroco don Antonio Jose
Martinez bautise solemnemente puse san-
tos oleos y sagrado crisma a un parvulo esposi-
to que el dia de ayer en la mañana amanecio
en la poblacion de la Sangre de Cristo junto a la
casa de Felipe Nerio Maes el que lo levanto
y trato de ampararlo no tenia signo algu-
no de que se le hubiese hechado la agua envuel-t
o en un pedaso de sarape viejo total abri-
go no pudo adquirir noticia de quien fuese
su madre el lo tomo por suyo [ILL] de dicho
lugar y su esposa Maria del Refugio Pache-
co y le puse por nombre Jose Francisco
fueron padrinos Antonio Cruz Vigil y Juana
Maria Vigil vecinos de la Plaza de Nuestra
Señora de Guadalupe a quienes adverti su obli-
gacion y parentesco espiritual y para que conste
firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Luisa
En este curato de Taos a los dos
dias del mes de enero deste año de mil
ochocientos cuarenta y cinco yo el parro-
co don Antonio Jose Martines bautise
solemnemente puse santos oleos y sa-
grado crisma segun rito de Nuestra Ma-
dre la Santa Yglesia para bautismo de a-
dultos a una adulta como de edad
de treinta años y le puse por nom-
bre Maria Luisa yndia rescatada de la
tribu yuta y para cuyo bautismo
precedieron los catequismos corres-
pondientes hasta que la haya bien ins-
truida en los principios medios y fin
de nuestra santa religion cristiana
la que abraso muy afectuosa y fer-
vorosamente y abjuro y renuncio cu-
alesquiera error de los gentiles barba-
ros en que habia instruida dicha
yndia es famula de don Carlos Beau-
bien y de la señora Maria Paula Lobato ve-
cinos de San Fernando fueron padrinos
Felis Nontin y Luz Trugillo vecinos
de la misma plasa a quienes ad-
verti su obligacion y parentesco
espiritual y para que conste fir-
me.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Soledad
En este curato de Taos a los veinte y
cuatro dias del mes de marzo de mil
ochocientos cuarenta y cinco yo el pa[*r]-
roco don Antonio Jose Martines ba[*u]-
tise solemnemente puse santos oleo[*s]
y sagrado crisma a una parvula
de dos dias de nacida y le puse por
nombre Maria Soledad hija natur[*al]
de Maria Guadalupe Bente yndia
servienta de Carlos Bente y la cual
es yndia rescatada de las nacion[*es]
del norte fueron padrinos Elfego
Bente y Maria Romualda Luna v[*e]-
cinos de la plaza de Nuestra [*Se]-
ñora de Guadalupe a quienes adverti
su obligacion y parenetesco espiritu-
al y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Soledad
En este curato de San Geronimo de Taos a
los cinco dias del mes de noviembre del año de mil
ochocientos cuarenta y cinco yo el parroco don Antonio
Jose Martinez habiendo presedido los catiquisanos
que fueron nescesarios sobre la instrucion de una
adulta como de edad de veinte años de descendiente
del tribo yuta de donde fue rescatada famu-
la de don Carlos Beaubien y de Doña Maria Paula
Lovato vecinos de la plasa de Nuestra Señora de
Guadalupe y habiendola hallado suficientamen-
te instruida en el principio medio y fin de
nuestra religion asi como determinada a bauti-
sare por los motivos propios y onestos que deben
nulitos[?] a esto la exorsice puse santos oleos
bautise solemnenamente y ungi el sagrado cris-
ma segun el rito de nuestra Santa Madre
Yglesia prevenido para el bautismo de
adultos fueron sus padrinos Jose Anto-
nio Lopez y Maria de Luz Beaubien
y la puse por nombre Maria Soledad y a los
padrinos adverti su obligacion y parentesco
espiritual y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Margarita
En este curato de Taos a los primer dia
del mes de marzo de mil ochocientos cua-
renta y seis yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Mar-
tines bautise solemnemente puse santos oleos
y sagrado crisma a una parvula de dos
años de edad y le puse por nombre
Maria Margarita desendiente de la tribu na-
bajo de donde fue rescatada es famula de
Jose Dolores Cordova y de Maria Ramona Mar-
tines vecinos de la [ILL] Sangre de
Cristo fueron padrinos Jose Felipe Nerio
Maes y Maria del Refugio Pacheco vesinos
del mismo lugar a quienes adverti su obli-
gacion y parentesco espiritual y para que
conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Rosalia
En este curato de Taos a los doce dia del mes de abril
del año de mil ochocientos cuarenta y seis yo el par-
roco don Antonio Jose Martines previos los cate-
quismos correspondientes hasta haberme certifica-
do de hallarse instruida una adulta en los prin-
cipios medios y fin de nuestra santa religion
y la piadosa afecion de cristianarse observar
los preceptos la exorcise puse santos oleos
bautise solemnemente y un ungi el sagrado
crisma segun los ritos de nuestra madre la
Santa Yglesia para bautismos de adultos y le
puse por nombre Maria Rosalia es famula
de don Juan de Jesus Mares vecino de la abo-
gacion de San Fransico de Paula
dicha adulta es descendiente de la tribu yuta de
donde fue rescatada fueron padrinos Juan
de los Reyes Mares y Maria de la Lus Trugillo
vecinos del mismo lugar a quienes adver-
ti su obligacion y parentesco espiritual y
ella misma quedo en inteligencia de obser-
var y guardar la doctrina de nuestra santa
religion y para que conste firme.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Maria Rosalia
En este curato de Taos a los veinte dias
del mes de junio de mil ochocientos cuarenta
y seis yo el parroco don Antonio Jose Martinez bau-
tise solemnemente puse santos oleos y sagra-
do crisma a una parvula de cinco años
de edad [^ y le puse por nombre Maria Rosalia]
descendiente de la tribu nabajo de
donde fue rescatada famula de Francisco
Salasar y de Maria Manuela Vigil vecinos
de la plaza de Santisima Trinidad fueron
padrinos Lusiano Salasar y Maria de la
Concepcion Salasar vecinos del mismo lu-
gar a quienes adverti su obligacion y pa-
rentesco espiritual y para que conste fir-
me.
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}
{left margin} Juana Maria
En este curato de Taos a los veinte y
un dias del mes de junio de mil ochoci-
entos cuarenta y seis yo el presbitero
don Eulogio Valdes venia parrochi previos
los catequismos correspondientes hasta
haberme certificado de hallarse ins-
truida una adulta en los principios
medio y fin de nuestra santa religion
y la piadora afecion de cristianarse
y observar los preceptos la exorcise
puse santos oleos bautise solemnemen-
te y ungi el sagrado crisma segun los
ritos de nuestra madre la Santa
Yglesia para bautismos de adultos y le
puse por nombre Juana Maria famula
de doña Maria Rafaela Barela vecina des-
ta plaza de Nuestra Señora de Guadalu-
pe dicha adulta es descendiente de
la tribu yuta de donde fue rescatada
fueron padrinos don Juan de Jesus Valdes
y Maria Juliana Trugillo vecinos del mis-
mo lugar a quienes adverti su obligacion
y parentesco espiritual y ella misma
quedo en inteligencia de observar y
quedar la doctrina de nuestra santa
religion y para que conste firme.
Eulogio Valdez {rubric}
Antonio Jose Martinez {rubric}

div.head: {left margin} José Rafael
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the fifth day of the month of August of the year 1839: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a six-day-old child. I named him José Rafael, natural son of Guadalupe Vigil, an Indian servant of the late José Vigil, resident of the town of La Santísima Trinidad de Arroyo Seco. His godparents were Francisco Tomás [Bentos?] and María Soledad Vigil, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} Juan Manuel
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the seventh day of the month of September of one thousand eight hundred and thirty-nine: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and chrism on an Indian child, seven or eight years old, who was rescued from the Ute tribe. Although it has been one year since he was rescued, he is still not sufficiently instructed, but being ill, and with the little that he has learned, he has effectively explained that he desires to join the religion of Jesus Christ. I verified that he is a servant of Don Charles Beaubien, resident of San Fernández. His godparents were Eugenio [Letendosen?] and María Rufina Vigil, also from San Fernández. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship. I signed it for the record. [^The name of the baptized child was Juan Manuel]

div.head: {left margin} María Soledad
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twenty-third day of the month of March of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, in urgent need due to illness, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult woman, about twenty years of age, which I did according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church regarding the baptism of adults. Having previously started catechism, she was found moderately instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, enough for her to be granted her request to become a Christian, in the condition that she was in. I named her María Soledad. She is a descendant of the Navajo tribe and a servant of Señora María Teodora Romero, who rescued her. The same Señora María Teodora Romero was her godmother, along with her son, Jorge Antonio, of the town of San Fernando. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship. I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Gabriela
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the thirteenth day of the month of August of one thousand eight hundred and forty: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized a child, two years old, whom I named María Gabriela, rescued from the Paiute nation and servant of José Gabriel Gallegos. Her godparents were José Nazario Gallegos and María Antonia Gallegos, residents of Arroyo Seco. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship. I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} José Miguel
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the third day of the month of November of one thousand eight hundred and forty-one: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old. I gave him the name José Miguel, an Indian rescued from the Ute tribe. He is a servant of Juan Antonio Abeyta, and his godfather was Pablo Garduño, both residents of the town of Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe. I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} José de la Cruz
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the second day of the month of February of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-two: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, received a request from the previous year to become a Christian from an adult male, 30 years old, descendant of the Jicarilla tribe. I had advised him that he should be instructed in the knowledge of the principal mysteries of our holy faith and religion, and in the commandments or precepts that Christians accept as their obligation, and the motives for wanting to become a Christian, warning him that the main purpose was to serve God in this life and afterward, to see Him, and to enjoy in the blessedness that He has for his chosen ones in the hereafter. As of this date, he had completed the corresponding catechisms. I found him to be instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, and that he was determined to become a Christian so that God would forgive all of his sins incurred up to the present time. [I found him] to be able to receive the other sacraments, ready to serve him faithfully from here on out in order to achieve eternal glory until the end of his days; that he will no longer believe in things of gentilism, of its errors and idolatries, but only in the true God. Now, by means of baptism, he tries to acknowledge and adore him with greater efficiency. By virtue of the authority that I have been granted by my ecclesiastic superior, I exorcized, placed holy oils, baptized him, and anointed him with chrism, all solemnly, according to the rite for the baptism of adults of our Holy Mother Church. His godparents were Francisco Esteban Vigil and María Rosalía Gallegos, residents of the town of Nuestra Señora de los Dolores. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Catarina
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twenty-fourth day of the month of May of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, six years old, a descendant of the Ute tribe from which the citizen José Mondragón, resident of the town of San Francisco del Rancho, rescued her. Her godparents were Felipe Nerio Maes and María del Refugio Pacheco, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María de la Luz
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twenty-sixth day of the month of June of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two: I, priest Don José de la Cruz Vigil, as curate, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a four-year-old child, and I named her María de la Luz. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe, servant of Don Juan Bolem, who rescued her, resident of San Francisco del Rancho. The godparents were Juan Bautista Bolem and María Luisa Archuleta, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Serafina
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twenty-sixth day of the month of June of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-two: I, priest Don Antonio José de la Cruz Vigil, as curate, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old, and I named her María Serafina. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe, servant of Don Juan Bolem, who rescued her, resident of San Francisco del Rancho. The godparents were Buenaventura Lobato and María Dolores Córdoba, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligations and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} José Santiago
div.p: In this parish of Taos, on the twenty-sixth of the month of June of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two: Having been catechized according to what is prescribed for the baptism of adults, and having obtained competent instruction, I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, according to the special rituals, solemnly exorcized, baptized, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, about thirteen years of age, a descendant of the Ute tribe. He is a servant of Don Juan Roles, who rescued him a few years ago. He has been educated in his house in the neighborhood of San Francisco del Rancho. I found him to be sufficiently instructed in the principles, means, and end of the Christian religion (and very enthusiastic, desirous, and aspiring to be received in her, with the faith and hope of obtaining eternal life). I named him José Santiago. His godparents were Manuel Antonio Sandoval and Margarita Martínez, all residents of San Francisco del Rancho. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Florentina
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the sixteenth day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a one-day-old infant. I named her María Florentina, natural daughter of an Indian servant of Señora Ignacia Jaramillo, resident of the town of Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe. The godparents were Francisco Jaramillo and María Romualda de Luna, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} Catarina
div.p: In this parish of Taos, on the eleventh day of the month of January of one thousand eight hundred and forty-two: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, out of extreme necessity, having certified her by virtue of catechisms and assessed her intention and desire of becoming a Christian, solemnly exorcised, baptized, and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, sixteen years old. I named her Catarina. She is an Indian servant of Don Juan Manuel Lucero, resident of the town of San Francisco de Paula. He himself was the godparent, along with his wife Juana María Martínez. I advised them of their obligation that, as masters of said servant, and also as godparents, they had to give and take care of her education, to teach her Christian duties, and the spiritual kinship that they contracted. I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} José Manuel
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twelfth day of the month of November of one thousand eight hundred and forty-three: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church for baptizing adults, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an Indian child, ten years old, who was rescued from the tribe of the north. I named him José Manuel. He is a servant of Don Gabriel Abeyta, who himself was the godparent, along with his wife, María de la Encarnación Romero, residents of the town of San Francisco del Rancho. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} Juan Francisco
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the tenth day of the month of December of one thousand eight hundred and forty-three: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, one month old. I named him Juan Francisco, descendant of the Ute tribe from which he was rescued. He is a servant of Antonio Díaz Armenta and María Isabel Sánchez. His godparents were Juan Antonio Madrid and María Manuela Romero, all residents of the town of Río Colorado. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Antonia
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the fourteenth day of the month of April of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, thirteen years old, of the Navajo tribe. I named her María Antonia, servant of Miguel Mascareñas, both residents of the town of Santa Gertrudis.

This baptism was according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church with the catechism and approval already having taken place. The godparents were Nazario Aguilar and María de la Cruz Mascareñas, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Josefa
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twenty-fifth day of the month of August of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, seven years old. She is of the Ute tribe, from whom she was rescued. She is a servant of Don Juan Manuel Lucero and Doña Juana María Martínez, the same were her godparents. They are residents of the town of San Francisco de Paula. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record. Her name is María Josefa.

div.head: {left margin} María Dolores
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twenty-fifth day of the month of August of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, according to the rite for the baptism of adults of our Holy Mother Church, solemnly baptized, exorcised, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, twelve years old. I named her María Dolores. She is an Indian of the Navajo tribe from which she was rescued. The steps of catechism were carried out and she was found well instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion. Desiring to be admitted to this practice through the holy sacrament of baptism, she recanted the errors and principles that she had acquired in her gentile sect, being completely willing and with the strongest resolution to live in observance of this Christian religion, which is conferred upon her in baptism. She is a servant of José del Espiritu Santo Córdoba. Her godparents were José Dolores Durán and Juana María de Gracia Sánchez, all residents of San Francisco del Rancho. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} José Matías
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the third day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four: Having carried out the corresponding catechisms until found to be well-instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly exorcised, baptized, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, eight years old, according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church for the baptism of adults. I named him José Matías. He is a servant of Fernando Trujillo and Juana María Trujillo, residents of the town of Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe. The same were also his godparents. The said adult is a descendant of the Ute tribe from which he was rescued. I advised the said godparents and masters of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Antonia
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the third day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, four years old. I named her María Antonia. She is Indian, descendant of the Ute tribe from which she was rescued. She is a servant of Doña María Rafaela Varela, resident of the town of Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe. The godparents were Pablo Valdez and María Magdalena Gallegos, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} Juan Lorenzo
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the fourth day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a six-year-old child of the Ute tribe from which he was rescued. I named him Juan Lorenzo. He is a servant of Juan Ignacio Martínez, both residents of the town of San Francisco del Rancho. The godparents were Benito Martínez and María Rosalía Mascareñas, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Soledad
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the fourth day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old. I named her María Soledad. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe, servant of Juan Ignacio Martínez, resident of San Francisco del Rancho. The godparents were José Rafael Martínez and María Rosa Martínez, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} Juan Francisco
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the fifth day of the month of October of one thousand eight hundred and forty-four: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a foundling child who yesterday morning appeared in the town of Sangre de Cristo next to the house of Felipe Nerio Maes who picked him up and sheltered him. There was no sign that he had been baptized. [He was] wrapped and completely bundled in a piece of an old sarape. As he was unable to learn who the mother was, he and his wife, María del Refugio Pacheco, took the child from said

place as their own. I named him José Francisco. The godparents were Antonio Cruz Vigil and Juana María Vigil, residents of the town of Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Luisa
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the second day of the month of January of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-four: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez solemnly baptized, placed holy oils and sacred chrism on an adult, about thirty years old, according to the rite of our Holy Mother Church for the baptism of adults. I named her María Luisa. She is an Indian rescued from the Ute tribe whose baptism was preceded by the corresponding catechisms until she was well instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy Christian religion. She embraced it affectionately and fervently, and she abjured and renounced any errors of the barbarian gentiles in which she had been instructed. The said Indian is a servant of Don Charles Beaubien and Señora María Paula Lobato, residents of San Fernando. The godparents were Feliz [Nontin] and Luz Trujillo, residents of the same place. I advised them of
their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Soledad
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twenty-fourth day of the month of March of one thousand eight hundred and forty-five: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a two-day-old child. I named her María Soledad. She is the natural daughter of María Guadalupe Bent, an Indian servant of Charles Bent, who had been rescued from the nations of the north. The godparents were Elfego Bent and María Romualda Luna, residents of the town of Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Soledad
div.p: In this parish of San Jerónimo de Taos on the fifth day of the month of November of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-five: Having already carried out the necessary catechisms for the instruction of an adult, and having found her sufficiently instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our religion, as well as determined to be baptized for her own honest motives that should [ILL], I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly exorcised, placed holy oils, baptized, and anointed with sacred chrism an adult, about twenty years old, according to the rite that Our Holy Mother Church prescribes for the baptism of adults. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe from which she was rescued, servant of Don Charles Beaubien and Doña María Paula Lobato, residents of the town of Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe. The godparents were José Antonio López and María de Luz Beaubien. I named her María Soledad, and I
advised the godparents of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Margarita
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the first day of the month of March of one thousand eight hundred and forty-six: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, two years old. I named her María Margarita. A descendant of the Navajo tribe from which she was rescued. She is a servant of José Dolores Córdoba and María Ramona Martínez, residents of the town of Sangre de Cristo. The godparents were José Felipe Nerio Maes and María del Refugio Pacheco, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Rosalía
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twelfth day of the month of April of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-six: Having already carried out the corresponding catechisms until I certified her to be instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, and having the pious affection of becoming a Christian and observing the precepts, I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly exorcised, placed holy oils, baptized and anointed with sacred chrism an adult, according to the rites of our Holy Church for the baptism of adults. I named her María Rosalía. She is a servant of Don Juan de Jesús Mares, resident of the town of San Francisco de Paula.

The said adult is a descendant of the Ute tribe, from which she was rescued. The godparents were Juan de los Reyes Mares and María de la Luz Trujillo, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship. She herself understands that she is to observe and keep the doctrine of our holy religion. I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} María Rosalía
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twentieth day of the month of June of one thousand eight hundred and forty-six: I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly baptized and placed holy oils and sacred chrism on a child, five years old. I named her María Rosalía, descendant of the Navajo tribe from which she was rescued. She is a servant of Francisco Salazar and María Manuela Vigil, residents of the town of La Santísima Trinidad. The godparents were Luciano Salazar and María de la Concepción Salazar, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligation and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.

div.head: {left margin} Juana María
div.p: In this parish of Taos on the twenty-first day of the month of June of one thousand eight-hundred and forty-six: Having already carried out the corresponding catechisms until I certified her to be instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our holy religion, and having the pious affection of becoming a Christian and observing the precepts, I, priest Don Eulogio Valdez, with permission from the parish priest, solemnly exorcised, placed holy oils, baptized and anointed [her] with sacred chrism according to the rites of our Holy Church for the baptism of adults. I named her Juana María, a servant of Doña María Rafaela Varela, resident of this town of Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe. The said adult is a descendant of the Ute tribe from which she was rescued. The godparents were Don Juan de Jesús Valdez and María Juliana Trujillo, residents of the same place. I advised them of their obligations and spiritual kinship, and I signed it for the record.
